Key Match Events: The Detroit Pistons managed to stave off any comeback attempts from the LA Lakers in the second half.
The Lakers managed to bring it down to five points in the fourth period, but the Pistons made another run.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers coach JJ Redick didn't put Dalton Knecht back in the game in the final two quarters and went with his starters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons increased their lead when the Lakers bench was playing, which highlighted the Purple and Gold's lack of depth.
The LA Lakers get a day off due to Election Day and will be back in action on Wednesday at the FedEx Forum against the Memphis Grizzlies.
Others: Dalton Knecht of the LA Lakers is one of the top rookies of the young season so far.
He finished with five points on perfect shooting 2-for-2.
Anthony Davis had a game-high 37 points plus nine rebounds and four assists, but it wasn't enough to prevent the defeat.
LeBron James added 20 points, eight rebounds and 11 assists, while Austin Reaves contributed 17 points, four rebounds and four assists.
